results.title: To extend a project of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission involving the Cannonsville Dam.
results.short_title: To extend a project of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission involving the Cannonsville Dam.
results.latest_major_action: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 139.
results.summary: This bill authorizes the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), upon request, to extend for up to eight years the time period during which construction must commence on the Cannonsville Hydroelectric Project located on the West Branch of the Delaware River in the Catskill Mountains of upstate New York. (The City of New York was granted a construction license for the Cannonsville Hydroelectric Project on May 13, 2014.) Additionally, FERC may reinstate the construction license if it is expired.
results.summary_short: This bill authorizes the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), upon request, to extend for up to eight years the time period during which construction must commence on the Cannonsville Hydroelectric Project located on the West Branch of the Delaware River in the Catskill Mountains of upstate New York. (The City of New York was granted a construction license for the Cannonsville Hydroelectric Project on May 13, 2014.) Additionally, FERC may reinstate the construction license if it is ex...

actions.description: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 139.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 400 - 1 (Roll no. 300). (text: CR H4829)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H4834-4835)

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2292.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H4829-4830)
Mr. Upton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 118.
Reported by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 115-174.
Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

votes.question: On Motion to Suspend the Rules and Pass
